verses.kjv: The words of Agur the son of Jakeh, even the prophecy: the man spake unto Ithiel, even unto Ithiel and Ucal,
verses.ct: These are the words of Agur son of Jakeh, an oracle. The man spoke to Ithiel, to Ithiel and Ucal:

verses.kjv: Surely I am more brutish than any man, and have not the understanding of a man.
verses.ct: "I am certainly more ignorant than anyone else, and I lack even basic human understanding.

verses.kjv: I neither learned wisdom, nor have the knowledge of the holy.
verses.ct: I never gained wisdom, and I have no knowledge of the Holy One.

verses.kjv: Who hath ascended up into heaven, or descended? who hath gathered the wind in his fists? who hath bound the waters in a garment? who hath established all the ends of the earth? what is his name, and what is his son’s name, if thou canst tell?
verses.ct: Who has gone up to heaven and come back down? Who has scooped up the wind in his hands? Who has wrapped the waters in a cloth? Who has set the boundaries of the whole earth? What is his name, and what is his son's name? Tell me if you know!

verses.kjv: Every word of God is pure: he is a shield unto them that put their trust in him.
verses.ct: Every word from God is flawless. He is a shield for those who take refuge in him.

verses.kjv: Add thou not unto his words, lest he reprove thee, and thou be found a liar.
verses.ct: Don't add anything to his words, or he will correct you and expose you as a liar.

verses.kjv: Two things have I required of thee; deny me them not before I die:
verses.ct: I'm asking you for 2 things; don't refuse me before I die:

verses.kjv: Remove far from me vanity and lies: give me neither poverty nor riches; feed me with food convenient for me:
verses.ct: Keep falsehood and dishonesty far from me. Don't give me either poverty or wealth; just provide me with the food I need.

verses.kjv: Lest I be full, and deny thee, and say, Who is the LORD? or lest I be poor, and steal, and take the name of my God in vain.
verses.ct: Otherwise, if I have too much, I might reject you and say, 'Who is the LORD?' Or if I become poor, I might steal and dishonor the name of my God."

verses.kjv: Accuse not a servant unto his master, lest he curse thee, and thou be found guilty.
verses.ct: Don't slander a servant to his master, or the servant will curse you and you'll be held responsible.

verses.kjv: There is a generation that curseth their father, and doth not bless their mother.
verses.ct: There is a kind of people who curse their father and refuse to honor their mother.

verses.kjv: There is a generation that are pure in their own eyes, and yet is not washed from their filthiness.
verses.ct: There is a kind of people who consider themselves pure but have never been cleansed from their own filth.

verses.kjv: There is a generation, O how lofty are their eyes! and their eyelids are lifted up.
verses.ct: There is a kind of people — how arrogant their eyes are! How high they raise their eyebrows!

verses.kjv: There is a generation, whose teeth are as swords, and their jaw teeth as knives, to devour the poor from off the earth, and the needy from among men.
verses.ct: There is a kind of people whose teeth are like swords and whose jaws are like knives, ready to consume the poor from the earth and the needy from among humanity.

verses.kjv: The horseleach hath two daughters, crying, Give, give. There are three things that are never satisfied, yea, four things say not, It is enough:
verses.ct: The leech has 2 daughters that cry, "Give! Give!" There are 3 things that are never satisfied, yes, 4 that never say, "Enough!":

verses.kjv: The grave; and the barren womb; the earth that is not filled with water; and the fire that saith not, It is enough.
verses.ct: The grave, the barren womb, land that never gets enough water, and fire that never says, "Enough!"

verses.kjv: The eye that mocketh at his father, and despiseth to obey his mother, the ravens of the valley shall pick it out, and the young eagles shall eat it.
verses.ct: The eye that mocks a father and scorns obedience to a mother — the ravens of the valley will pluck it out, and the young vultures will devour it.

verses.kjv: There be three things which are too wonderful for me, yea, four which I know not:
verses.ct: There are 3 things that amaze me, yes, 4 that I cannot understand:

verses.kjv: The way of an eagle in the air; the way of a serpent upon a rock; the way of a ship in the midst of the sea; and the way of a man with a maid.
verses.ct: How an eagle soars through the air, how a snake moves across a rock, how a ship navigates the open sea, and how a man wins the heart of a young woman.

verses.kjv: Such is the way of an adulterous woman; she eateth, and wipeth her mouth, and saith, I have done no wickedness.
verses.ct: This is how an unfaithful woman operates: she eats, wipes her mouth, and says, "I haven't done anything wrong."

verses.kjv: For three things the earth is disquieted, and for four which it cannot bear:
verses.ct: Under 3 things the earth trembles, and under 4 it cannot hold up:

verses.kjv: For a servant when he reigneth; and a fool when he is filled with meat;
verses.ct: A servant who becomes king, and a fool who is stuffed with food,

verses.kjv: For an odious woman when she is married; and an handmaid that is heir to her mistress.
verses.ct: a despised woman who gets married, and a servant girl who takes the place of her mistress.

verses.kjv: There be four things which are little upon the earth, but they are exceeding wise:
verses.ct: There are 4 things on earth that are small but remarkably wise:

verses.kjv: The ants are a people not strong, yet they prepare their meat in the summer;
verses.ct: Ants are not strong creatures, yet they store up their food during the summer.

verses.kjv: The conies are but a feeble folk, yet make they their houses in the rocks;
verses.ct: Rock badgers are a vulnerable species, yet they build their homes among the cliffs.

verses.kjv: The locusts have no king, yet go they forth all of them by bands;
verses.ct: Locusts have no ruler, yet they march forward together in perfect formation.

verses.kjv: The spider taketh hold with her hands, and is in kings’ palaces.
verses.ct: A lizard can be caught with bare hands, yet it finds its way into royal palaces.

verses.kjv: There be three things which go well, yea, four are comely in going:
verses.ct: There are 3 things that move with impressive stride, yes, 4 that carry themselves with dignity:

verses.kjv: A lion which is strongest among beasts, and turneth not away for any;
verses.ct: A lion, the mightiest among animals, which does not retreat from anything,

verses.kjv: A greyhound; an he goat also; and a king, against whom there is no rising up.
verses.ct: a strutting rooster, a male goat, and a king whose army stands with him.

verses.kjv: If thou hast done foolishly in lifting up thyself, or if thou hast thought evil, lay thine hand upon thy mouth.
verses.ct: If you've been foolish enough to promote yourself, or if you've been plotting evil, put your hand over your mouth and stop.

verses.kjv: Surely the churning of milk bringeth forth butter, and the wringing of the nose bringeth forth blood: so the forcing of wrath bringeth forth strife.
verses.ct: Just as churning milk produces butter and twisting a nose produces blood, so stirring up anger produces conflict.
